newsitem.title: RUSSIA: PRESS DIGEST - RUSSIA IZVESTIA - JUNE 19.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - RUSSIA IZVESTIA - JUNE 19.

text.p: Following are some of the leading stories in the June 20 edition of Russia's Izvestia newspaper. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
- Russia, which still has problems with Chechnya, is likely to lose its part in two new oil pipeline projects involving Turkey, Ukraine and Kazakhstan.
- Despite all the talk about Russia becoming a full member of a group of wealthiest industrial countries, President Yeltsin will not participate in financial talks at the summit in Denver.
- The powerful military and industrial lobby in the State Duma lower house of parliament has been resisting passing a law on arms trade which preserves state control over this business.
- Russia and Israel have signed an unprecedented agreement on joint production of A-50 military aircraft.
